topic.title: Data Buckets
topic.shortdesc: Couchbase Server provides a range of statistics and settings through the Data Buckets and Server Nodes tabs.

body.p: Statistics shows the overview and detailed information so that administrators can better understand the current state of individual nodes and the cluster as a whole.

The Data Buckets screen displays a list of all the configured buckets on your system (of both Couchbase and memcached types). It provides a quick overview of your cluster health from the perspective of the configured buckets, rather than whole cluster or individual servers.
For each bucket, the following information is provided in each column:

dlentry.dd:
The given name for the bucket.
Click the Bucket Name link to open the basic bucket information summary.
The number of objects stored in the bucket.
The number of operations per second for this data bucket.
The number of operations required to fetch items from disk.
The amount of RAM used for active objects against the configured bucket size.
The amount of disk space in use for the active object data storage.

ul.li: Click the Documents button to see a list of objects identified as parseable documents.
Click the Views button to create and manage views on your stored objects.
Click the Create New Data Bucket to create a new bucket.
